bioghist.p: Charles Brackbill, Jr. (b. 1921), was a Presbyterian minister who worked in planning for radio and television broadcasting for the Presbyterian Church USA. He was a 1948 graduate of Princeton Theological Seminary and did graduate work at Union Theological Seminary. He was pastor at Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church in Elizabeth, New Jersey, from 1948 to 1954, before becoming Associate Executive and Director of Radio and Television of the Synod of New Jersey. In 1964 he was named Associate Chairman for Planning with responsibility for long-range planning for the Division of Radio and Television of the UPCUSA.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Charles Brackbill related to his work for the Division of Radio/TV of the UPCUSA. Materials include policy papers, market analyses, reports, minutes, and planning documents. Specific items in the collection include a 1961 packet on standards for local council broadcasting, a 1961 critique of religious radio by Brackbill, a 1961 New Jersey Council of Churches yearbook of religious broadcasting, a 1966 five-year plan for the Division of Radio/TV Audio-Visual of the UPCUSA, and minutes of the Ad Board, 1968.
